title: Hypocenter
summary: A hypocenter (or hypocentre; from Ancient Greek  ὑπόκεντρον (hupόkentron) 'below the center') is the point of origin of an earthquake or a subsurface nuclear explosion. In seismology, it is a synonym of the focus.[1] Outside seismology, the term hypocenter is also used as a synonym for  ground zero, the surface point directly beneath a nuclear airburst.
